column4: HBO offered $250 000 to hackers in bid to delay data release
column5: Time Warner Inc's  HBO network last month offered $250 000 to cyber criminals who hacked into its computer system  asking them to extend a deadline for paying a much larger ransom  according to an email reviewed by Reuters. | Video

column4: UPDATE 1-HBO offered $250 000 to hackers in bid to delay data release

column4: Fitch Upgrades Malta to 'A+'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) Link to Fitch Ratings' Report: Malta - Rating Action Report https://www.fitchratings.com/site/re/902365 LONDON  August 11 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has upgraded Malta's Long-Term Foreign- and Local-Currency Issuer Default Ratings (IDR) to 'A+' from 'A'. The Outlooks are Stable. The issue ratings on Malta's senior unsecured foreign- and local-currency bonds have also been upgraded to 'A+' from 'A'. The Country Ceiling has been affirmed at 'A

column4: 8th Circuit strikes down Toyota appeal in unintended acceleration suit
column5: A federal appeals court on Friday broadly upheld a lower court's evidentiary rulings in a trial over a fatal 2006 car crash in Minnesota that resulted in an $11 million verdict against Toyota Motor Corp.

column4: Vale investors overwhelmingly join share conversion plan
column5: SAO PAULO Investors in Brazil's Vale SA have overwhelmingly agreed to swap their preferred stock into common shares  handling the world's No. 1 iron ore producer a victory in a plan that will give equal votes to all shareholders and limit government meddling.

column4: UPDATE 1-Vale investors overwhelmingly join share conversion plan
column5: SAO PAULO  Aug 10 Investors in Brazil's Vale SA have overwhelmingly agreed to swap their preferred stock into common shares  handling the world's No. 1 iron ore producer a victory in a plan that will give equal votes to all shareholders and limit government meddling.

column4: Vale reaches mininum threshold for voluntary share conversion
column5: SAO PAULO  Aug 10 Brazilian miner Vale SA has reached a mininum threshold set for a proposed voluntary share conversion  after about 72 percent of current shareholders agreed to swap their preferred stock into common shares.

column4: Netflix discussing keeping Disney's Marvel  'Star Wars' films
column5: LOS ANGELES Netflix Inc is in "active discussions" with Walt Disney Co about keeping Marvel and "Star Wars" films after 2019  when new Disney and Pixar movies will stop appearing on the streaming service  a senior executive said late on Thursday.

column4: Judge tosses former Disney workers' lawsuit over hiring of Indian nationals
column5: By Daniel Wiessner A federal judge in Florida has dismissed a proposed discrimination class action by former Disney World employees who say they were forced to train foreign replacements before being laid off.
